isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB DOOR AND HINGE (BEFORE DECEMBER 5, 1994)

svcprocinfo.para: An integral door stop (60 degree opening) (Item 1, Figure 18) is included in the upper hinge used with this door. If hinges are removed, upper and lower hinges should not be interchanged.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Integral Door Stop in Upper Hinge

svcprocinfo.para: There is no disassembly of hinges since they are serviced as a complete unit. It should also be noted that mounting holes (Item 3, Figure 19) are enlarged on the hinge to provide adjustment for positioning cab door in door opening.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Door Hinge and Access Plugs

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. ENLARGED MOUNTING HOLES FOR DOOR ADJUSTMENT

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Remove door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Remove.
Remove door hinge access plugs (Item 1, Figure 19).

If vehicle is equipped with power windows, courtesy lamps, heated mirrors or CB radio antenna on the door, mark the harness connectors for installation, disconnect harness connectors and remove two screws holding the wiring harness bracket (Item 3, Figure 17) on the edge of door, one each for CB coax cable and wiring harness (Items 5 and 6, Figure 17). Pull the harness clear of the door.
Use a rope sling (or padded chain) through window opening and attach sling to overhead lift and support door.
Remove the four flange head hinge mounting bolts through the access holes (Item 3, Figure 19), two each hinge, and lift door assembly from hinges (Item 4, Figure 19).
Move the door to a work bench or other support as required. Cover the bench with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of the door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 20for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before removing hinges from cab hinge pillar (Item 3), mark upper and lower hinge position on cab hinge pillar with grease pencil or similar marker to simplify door adjustment on reassembly. Remove the three flange head mounting bolts (Item 1) and remove door hinge (Item 2) from the hinge pillar.

svcsubproc.para: The flange head mounting bolt (Item 1) recessed behind hinge inside pillar can best be removed with a universal (flex) socket. Be careful when removing bolt to avoid dropping it inside the pillar.

svcsubproc.title: Install

step1.para: Position upper and lower door hinge onto cab hinge pillar (Items 2 and 3, Figure 20) with the aid of markings on hinge pillar. Use a universal (flex) socket and install the flange head bolts. Tighten to 13 to 15 ft-lbs. (17.6 to 20 N·m).

note.para: Be sure the hinge with the integral door stop is put back in the upper door hinge location.

step1.para: Using a rope sling (or padded chain) through window opening, attach sling to overhead lift and support door.
Position door assembly onto door hinges (Item 4, Figure 19) and secure with four flange head bolts (Item 1, Figure 19), two each hinge. Tighten to 20 to 28 ft-lbs. (27 to 38 N·m).

If vehicle is equipped with power windows, courtesy lamps, heated mirrors or CB radio antenna on the door, position wiring harness on the door and reconnect harness connectors (Item 2, Figure 17). Position wiring harness brackets (Item 3, Figure 17) in place on the edge of door and secure with two screws, one each for CB coax cable and wiring harness (Items 5 and 6, Figure 17).
Install door hinge access plugs (Item 1, Figure 19).
Install door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Install.

svcsubproc.para: Adjust the door as required. Refer to ADJUSTMENTS.
